# Pull Request

## What does this change?

Briefly explain what you changed and why.

If this is a refactor, say so.
If this fixes a bug, say which one.
If this adds a feature, explain the use case.

Vibes-based descriptions are discouraged.

## How was this tested?

List the commands you actually ran.

Examples:

- npm test
- npm run build
- npm pack --dry-run
- manual testing on branch feature/foo with tags v1.2.3

If you didn’t test it, say so.

## Behavior changes

Does this change how versions are calculated or output?

Old behavior:
New behavior:

If there is no behavior change, explicitly say “No behavior change”.

## Breaking changes

- [ ] Yes
- [ ] No

If yes, explain what breaks and why it’s worth it.

## Checklist

- [ ] I ran the tests
- [ ] I ran the build
- [ ] I checked packaging if relevant
- [ ] I updated docs if behavior changed
- [ ] I am not submitting accidental junk

## Final notes

Anything reviewers should pay attention to:
edge cases, branch/tag assumptions, CI weirdness, etc.

If there’s nothing special, that’s fine.
Silence is better than rambling.
